intro: Arachne montana, commonly known as the mountain arachne, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Arachne montana is often found in alpine meadows and is considered a relatively rare and specialized species.
